keyMoments.title: Diagnosed with Love Sickness
keyMoments.description: Nyon diagnoses Hancock's mysterious illness as love sickness, revealing that she has fallen in love with Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms Hancock's romantic feelings for Luffy and explains her physical symptoms. This is a defining character moment.

keyMoments.title: Love for Luffy Confirmed
keyMoments.description: Hancock immediately recovers her strength and rushes to meet Luffy when she hears he wants to see her.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the depth of Hancock's feelings through her physical reaction.

keyMoments.title: Agrees to Help Luffy
keyMoments.description: Hancock shocks her sisters by immediately agreeing to help Luffy rescue his brother Ace.
keyMoments.significance: This decision sets in motion the events of Impel Down and demonstrates Hancock's devotion to Luffy.
keyMoments.quote: I will help you save your brother. I will happily answer the call to war and go wherever you wish.

keyMoments.title: Leaves Amazon Lily
keyMoments.description: Hancock leaves Amazon Lily for the first time in years to help Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Major character development as Hancock breaks from her isolation to follow her heart.

keyMoments.title: Unfreezes the Marines
keyMoments.description: Hancock uses her Mero Mero no Mi powers to reverse the petrification of the Marines.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates her control over her Devil Fruit abilities and her willingness to cooperate.

abilities.description: Hancock can reverse the petrification effect of her Mero Mero no Mi, restoring victims to normal with no memory of being frozen.

relationships.description: Hancock has fallen deeply in love with Luffy, suffering from love sickness because of her feelings.

evolutionMoments.description: Nyon officially diagnoses Hancock's love sickness, confirming her romantic feelings for Luffy.
Hancock agrees to help Luffy rescue Ace, showing her devotion.

relationships.description: Nyon serves as Hancock's advisor and helps her understand her love sickness.

evolutionMoments.description: Nyon diagnoses Hancock's illness and advises her to follow her heart.

reveals.information: Suffering from love sickness due to falling in love with Luffy
Can reverse petrification at will, with victims having no memory of being frozen
Willing to leave Amazon Lily and break tradition for love

keyMoments.title: Diagnoses Hancock's Love Sickness
keyMoments.description: Nyon correctly identifies Hancock's illness as love sickness and explains the condition to her sisters.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Nyon's wisdom and understanding of love sickness from personal experience.
keyMoments.quote: All the previous empresses died from being away from their loved ones. This illness is called love sickness.

keyMoments.title: Explains Love Sickness
keyMoments.description: Nyon provides detailed explanation of love sickness, its symptoms, and how previous empresses died from it.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes crucial world-building about Amazon Lily culture and reveals Nyon survived love sickness herself.
keyMoments.quote: The feelings of emotion are like a hurricane, hitting when least expected.

relationships.description: Serves as Hancock's wise advisor, particularly regarding love sickness.

evolutionMoments.description: Nyon diagnoses and explains Hancock's love sickness, demonstrating her role as a crucial advisor.

reveals.information: Survived love sickness herself by leaving Amazon Lily to follow her love
Has deep understanding of love sickness and its effects on Kuja empresses

keyMoments.title: Receives Hancock's Agreement
keyMoments.description: Luffy's request for help is accepted by Hancock, who agrees to help him save Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Secures crucial assistance for the rescue mission to Impel Down.

keyMoments.title: Hides on Marine Ship
keyMoments.description: Luffy hides beneath Hancock's robe aboard Vice Admiral Momonga's ship, beginning his infiltration toward Impel Down.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of Luffy's dangerous infiltration mission to rescue Ace.

relationships.description: Luffy trusts Hancock to help him rescue Ace, establishing a close friendship.

evolutionMoments.description: Hancock agrees to help Luffy reach Impel Down, cementing their alliance.

keyMoments.title: Learns of Whitebeard's Mobilization
keyMoments.description: Sengoku receives news that all 23 Marine ships guarding Whitebeard have vanished, confirming the Whitebeard Pirates are mobilizing.
keyMoments.significance: Escalates the crisis and confirms the inevitable war is approaching.
keyMoments.quote: Don't annoy me unless it's about Whitebeard!

keyMoments.title: Reveals Jinbe's Imprisonment
keyMoments.description: Sengoku reveals that Jinbe refused to participate in the war and was sent to Impel Down.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the fractures in the Warlord system as war approaches.

reveals.information: Facing the crisis of Whitebeard's mobilization and war preparations

keyMoments.title: Visits Ace in Impel Down
keyMoments.description: Garp arrives at Impel Down to visit his imprisoned grandson Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights the emotional conflict between Garp's duty as a Marine and his love for his grandson.

relationships.description: Garp is Ace's grandfather, creating painful conflict between duty and family.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp visits Ace at Impel Down, showing his emotional conflict.

reveals.information: Torn between Marine duty and love for his grandson Ace

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Receives Visit from Garp
keyMoments.description: Ace is visited by his grandfather Garp while imprisoned at Impel Down.
keyMoments.significance: Emphasizes Ace's situation and the emotional stakes of the upcoming war.

statusHistory.condition: Held at Impel Down awaiting execution

bounties.reason: Captain of Spade Pirates, later 2nd Division Commander of Whitebeard Pirates

relationships.description: Ace is Garp's grandson, creating emotional conflict for Garp.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp visits Ace at Impel Down.

keyMoments.title: Refuses to Fight Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Jinbe refuses to participate in the war against Whitebeard and is imprisoned at Impel Down.
keyMoments.significance: First mention of Jinbe's loyalty to Whitebeard and his principled stance, foreshadowing his alliance with Luffy.

statusHistory.condition: Sent to Impel Down for refusing to fight Whitebeard

relationships.description: Jinbe has strong loyalty to Whitebeard and refuses to fight against him.

evolutionMoments.description: Jinbe refuses to participate in the war against Whitebeard, showing his loyalty.

reveals.information: Willing to give up his Warlord position rather than betray his principles and friendship with Whitebeard
Imprisoned at Impel Down for refusing to fight Whitebeard

keyMoments.title: Hancock Boards His Ship
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Momonga successfully convinces Hancock to board his Marine ship.
keyMoments.significance: His patience pays off as Hancock agrees to travel to Marine Headquarters.

keyMoments.title: Marines Are Unfrozen
keyMoments.description: Hancock unfreezes Momonga's crew, allowing them to resume their journey.
keyMoments.significance: Resolves the standoff from the previous episode.
